q: its top management on Thursday, announcing that co-founder Larry Page would replace Eric Schmidt as chief executive of the Internet giant in April. Google said Eric Schmidt would remain with the company as executive chairman, focusing on deals, partnerships, customers, broader business relationships( and) government outreach. Eric Schmidt , who has served as Google's CEO for a decade, will also act as an internal adviser to Page and to Google's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , the Mountain View, California-based company said
